gurmukhi: inrK bwl inj rUp pRB khy bYn muskwie ] kvn qwq bwlk qumY kvn iqhwrI mwie ]809]
transliteration: Nirakh Baal Nij Roop Prabh Kahe Bain Mouskaae|| Kavan Taat Baalak Toumai Kavan Tihaarimaae||809||
translation: Seeing the children as his own replica, Ram asked smilingly, “O boys ! who are your parents?”809.

gurmukhi: imQlw pur rwjw ] jnk suBwjw ] iqh iss sIqw ] Aq suB gIqw ]810]
transliteration: Mithlaa Pur Raajaa|| Janak Soubhaajaa|| Tih Sis Seetaa|| At Soubh Geetaa||810||
translation: “Sita, the daughter of the king Janak of Mithilapur is beautiful like a propitious song;810.

gurmukhi: so bin Awey ] iqh hm jwey ] hYN duie BweI ] suin rGurweI ]811]
transliteration: So Ban(i) Aae|| Tih Ham Jaae|| Hain Due Bhaaee|| Soun(i) Raghuraaee||811||
translation: “O the king of Raghu clan ! she has come to the forest and given birth to us and we are two brothers.”811.

gurmukhi: sin sIA rwnI ] rGubr jwnI ] icq pihcwnI ] muK n bKwnI ]812]
transliteration: Soun(i) Seea Raanee|| Raghoubr Jaanee|| Chit Paihchaanee|| Moukh Na Bakhaanee||812||
translation: When Sita heard and came to know about Ram, she then, even recognizing him, did not utter a word from her mouth.812.

gurmukhi: iqh iss mwnXo ] Aq bl jwnXo ] hiT rx kIno ] kh nhI dIno ]813]
transliteration: Tih Sis Maanyo|| At Bal Jaanyo|| Hath(i) Ran Keeno|| Kah Nahideeno||813||
translation: She forbade her sons and told them, “Ram is extremely mighty, you are persistently waging a war against him.” Saying this even Sita did not say the whole thing.813.

gurmukhi: kis sr mwry ] iss nhI hwry ] bhu ibD bwxM ] Aq Dnu qwxM ]814]
transliteration: Kas(i) Sar Mdare|| Sis Nahigdare|| Bahu Bidh Baanan|| At Dhan(u) Taanan||814||
translation: Those boys did not retreat and accept defeat and discharged their arrows with full force after stretching their bows.814.

gurmukhi: AMg AMg byDy ] sB qn Cydy ] sB dl sUJy ] rGubr jUJy ]815]
transliteration: An An Bedhe|| Sabh Tan Chhede|| Sabh Dal Soojhe|| Raghoubar Joojhaa||815||
translation: Al the limbs of Ram were pierced and his whole body eroded, the whole army came to know this that Ram had passed away.815.

gurmukhi: jb pRB mwry ] sB dl hwry ] bhu ibiD Bwgy ] duAY iss Awgy ]816]
transliteration: Jab Prabh Mdare|| Sabh Dal Hdare|| Bahu Dal Hdare|| Bahu Bidh(i) Bhaage|| Duai Sis Aage||816||
translation: When Ram passed away, then the whole army began to flee accordingly in front of those two boys.816.

gurmukhi: iPr n inhwrYN ] pRBU n icqwrYN ] gH ids lInw ] As rx kInw ]817]
transliteration: Phir Na Nihdarain|| Prabhoo Na Chitdarain|| Grah Dis Leenaa|| As Ran Keena||817||
translation: They were not even turning around to see Ram, and being helpless they fled away to whichever side they could.817.

gurmukhi: qb duhUM bwl AXoDn dyKw ] mno rudR kIVw bn pyKw ]
transliteration: Tab Duhoon Baal Ayodhan Dekhaa|| Mano Rudra Keedaa Ban Pekhaa||
translation: Then both the boys without any anxiety, looked towards the battlefield like Rudra surveying the forest;

gurmukhi: kwt Dujn ky biR`C svwry ] BUKn AMg AnUp auqwry ]818]
transliteration: Kaat Dhujan Ke Brichchh Savdare|| Bhookhanndan Anoop Outdare||818||
translation: The banners were cut and attached to the trees and the unique ornaments of the soldiers were removed from their limbs and thrown away.818.

gurmukhi: mUrC Bey sB ley auTeI ] bwj sihq qh gy jh mweI ]
transliteration: Moondachh Bhae Sabh Lae Outhaaee|| Baaj Sahit Tah Ge Jah Maaee||
translation: Those who were unconscious, the boys raised them and reached the place alongwith the horses, where Sita was sitting;
